title: (x) Retro font used in Justin Thomas Kay typography poster - Motter Ombra {Rainer}
content:
Hello everyone!  
This is my first post here on Typophile!  
I’ve a question:  
i’m searching for the type used in a [Justin Thomas kay’s typography poster!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005513/http:/industrial-organic.net/wp-content/uploads/2007/08/NT_version.gif),

this is an example of the font i’m looking for:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005513im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/font%20kay_5781.jpg)

Thank you for the attention!

Bye ;)

 [‹ (x) Faithless logo sans - Interstate {Jan E}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005513/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39068 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "TimberTech - Less Work, More Life" logo - Futura, Times, Stymie {Patricia} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005513/http:/www.typophile.com/node/39067 "Go to next forum topic")
author: VisualPollution

comments.content: There was a freefont-digitization flying around called »Motter Hombre«, but I think it was only lowercases and with added cyrillic letters, I think.
Just out of curiosity — did you read the FAQ? Because your thread title is exemplary. ;)
Wow! After all, it was worthwhile writing that thing … ;°)

… and I see that the sons of Othmar Motter, Siegfried and Peter, are planning to revive their type-spirit. See for yourself at [Motterfonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080204005513/http:/www.motterfonts.com/).
Now that we know they will/are be/ing revived I think we should no longer point anyone toward free versions.
